name: 黃秀英
objective: Basic principles of finite element method and its related applications will be introduced. Students will have chance to do hands-on practice. The course contents include: introduction to basic theory of finite element method/analysis, principle of variation, shape functions, one-dimensional, two-dimensional, and three-dimensional problems.
schedule:
1　　Syllabus and Introduction (Ch1)
2　　One Dimensional Elements and Computational Procedures (Ch2)
3　　Basic Elements (Ch3)
4　　Formulation Techniques: Variational Methods (Ch4)
5　　Formulation Techniques: Galerkin and Other Weighted Residual Methods (Ch5)
6　　Isoparametric Elements (Ch6)
7　　Isoparametric Triangles and Tetrahedra (Ch7)
8　　Coordinate Transformation and Selected Analysis Options (Ch8), Define the semester project topics.  Report outline due next week
9　　Review & Midterm Exam
10　　Error Estimation and Convergence (Ch9), Student Midterm Exam Evaluation
11　　Modeling Considerations and Software Use (Ch10)
12　　Finite Elements in Structural Dynamics and Vibrations (Ch11)
13　　Heat Transfer and Selected Fluid Problems (Ch12)
14　　Constraints: Penalty Forms, Locking, and Constraint Counting (Ch13) & Solids of Revolution (Ch14)
15　　Plate Bending (Ch15) & Shells (Ch16)
16　　Nonlinearity: An Introduction (Ch17)
17　　Project Presentation
18　　Class Review & Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1.　　Midterm Exam：20 %
2.　　Final Exam: 25%
3.　　Homework：20 %
4.　　Project written report (15%), Project oral presentation (15%)
5.　　In-class discussion, participation and attendance (5%)
6.　　Homework is due a week away from the day assigned.  5 points would be subtracted per each single day delay.  Delaying for 2 days or more would get no point.
7.　　The Project report is due the day of the oral presentation.  5 points would be subtracted per each single day delay.  Delaying for 3 days or more would get no point.
8.　　Copy and cheating are not allowed.  If one is found copy and cheating, 0 point would be given for the event.
